utility.cc
00001 /* File: utiliy.cc
00002  * ---------------
00003  * Implementation of simple printing functions to report failures or
00004  * debugging information triggered by keys.
00005  */
00006 
00007 #include "utility.h"
00008 #include <stdarg.h>
00009 #include <string.h>
00010 #include <vector>
00011 using std::vector;
00012 
00013 static vector<const char*> debugKeys;
00014 static const int BufferSize = 2048;
00015 
00016 void Failure(const char *format, ...) {
00017   va_list args;
00018   char errbuf[BufferSize];
00019   
00020   va_start(args, format);
00021   vsprintf(errbuf, format, args);
00022   va_end(args);
00023   fflush(stdout);
00024   fprintf(stderr,"\n*** Failure: %s\n\n", errbuf);
00025   abort();
00026 }
00027 
00028 int IndexOf(const char *key) {
00029   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < debugKeys.size(); i++)
00030     if (!strcmp(debugKeys[i], key)) 
00031       return i;
00032 
00033   return -1;
00034 }
00035 
00036 bool IsDebugOn(const char *key) {
00037   return (IndexOf(key) != -1);
00038 }
00039 
00040 void SetDebugForKey(const char *key, bool value) {
00041   int k = IndexOf(key);
00042   if (!value && k != -1)
00043     debugKeys.erase(debugKeys.begin() + k);
00044   else if (value && k == -1)
00045     debugKeys.push_back(key);
00046 }
00047 
00048 void PrintDebug(const char *key, const char *format, ...) {
00049   va_list args;
00050   char buf[BufferSize];
00051 
00052   if (!IsDebugOn(key))
00053      return;
00054   
00055   va_start(args, format);
00056   vsprintf(buf, format, args);
00057   va_end(args);
00058   printf("+++ (%s): %s%s", key, buf, buf[strlen(buf)-1] != '\n'? "\n" : "");
00059 }
00060 
00061 void ParseCommandLine(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00062   if (argc == 1)
00063     return;
00064   
00065   if (strcmp(argv[1], "-d") != 0) { // first arg is not -d
00066     printf("Incorrect Use:   ");
00067     for (int i = 1; i < argc; i++) printf("%s ", argv[i]);
00068     printf("\n");
00069     printf("Correct Usage:   -d <debug-key-1> <debug-key-2> ... \n");
00070     exit(2);
00071   }
00072 
00073   for (int i = 2; i < argc; i++)
00074     SetDebugForKey(argv[i], true);
00075 }
